meanings.definition: To steal goods from (a place or person), typically using force and in a time of war or civil disorder.
meanings.sent1: The pirates plundered the treasure chest on the deserted island.
meanings.sent2: The thieves plundered the store during the chaos of the riot.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoons plundered the picnic basket when nobody was looking.
meanings.sent4: The storm plundered the coastline, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The Vikings plundered the village, taking everything of value.
